title: Metrics for Measuring Change Management

introduction.importance: Research shows a strong correlation between measuring compliance and overall performance with meeting project objectives

statistics.measurement_adoption: 63% of participants agreed or strongly agreed they measured compliance with change
statistics.success_rate_with_measurement: 76% of those who measured compliance met or exceeded project objectives
statistics.success_rate_without_measurement: Only 24% of those who didn't measure compliance met or exceeded objectives

prerequisites.common_definition: Having a common definition of success is critical before measuring effectiveness
definition_components: Project objectives (what the project will achieve)
Organizational benefits (what the organization will gain)

challenges.main_obstacle: 40% identified lack of alignment on goals and objectives as main reason change success was not defined

steps.step: Engage key stakeholders in co-creating a shared definition of success
Identify KPIs for measuring effectiveness of change management plans
recommendations: Encourage clear success criteria definition early
Include adoption and use metrics beyond technical implementation
Introduce people-side metrics early alongside technical metrics
Limit metrics to few simple, trackable ones

levels.question: How well did we do change management?
levels.description: Measures completion, execution and effectiveness of change management methodology
metrics: Progress in executing change management strategy
Completeness of master change management plan
Progress in executing change management plans

levels.question: How effectively did individuals adopt and use the change?
levels.description: Measures individual and group transitions through ADKAR model

human_factors.description: How quickly people adopt the change
metrics: Time to learn and apply new skills
Number of users at various time intervals post go-live

human_factors.description: How many people adopt the change
metrics: System usage tracking compared to total impacted employees

human_factors.description: How well people apply the change

levels.question: Did the initiative deliver what was expected?
levels.description: Measures if project objectives were met and benefits realized

accountability.primary_sponsor: Identifying definition of success and ensuring achievement
accountability.change_practitioner: Extracting and packaging definition of success

levels.tools: Prosci Change Triangle (PCT) Assessment to measure project health

conclusion: The ability to clearly define success and measure results on change projects is increasingly important for change practitioners
